title: Planning Commission
description: Established in 1946, the Planning Commission envisions Santa Monica as a city of wellbeing, sustainability, and equity, and seeks to balance the many needs and priorities within our community in accordance with the Citys General Plan and Specific Plans. The Commission acts through open and civil discourse that is informed by public input, impartial analysis, and best practices in land use and planning.

title: Main Library Book Group
description: Join a community discussion of current and classic books, alternating fiction and nonfiction each month. December's title is 'Rosalind Franklin: Dark Lady of DNA' by Brenda Maddox. Email jeff.schwartz@smgov.net for the Zoom link.
address:
Virtual
Santa Monica, CA 90401

title: Architectural Review Board Meeting
description: The Architectural Review Board established in 1974, acts to preserve existing areas of natural beauty, cultural importance and assure that buildings, structures, signs or other developments are in good taste, good design, harmonious with surrounding developments, and in general contribute to the preservation of Santa Monica's reputation as a place of beauty, spaciousness and quality.

title: Commission on Sustainability, Environmental Justice, and the Environment
description:
The Task Force on the Environment was established in 1991 by the Santa Monica City Council to advise City Council on environmental program and policy issues. The Task Force on the Environment was the driving force behind the development of Santa Monicas Sustainable City Plan in the early 1990s and continues to closely monitor the plan and advise Council on plan implementation. On July 27, 2021, the Task Force became a permenant commission named the Commission on Sustainability, Environmental Justice, and the Environment.

The Commission is an expert panel made up of seven members selected by City Council. Commissioners must have significant expertise in one or more areas of environmental policy and must reside or work in Santa Monica.
address:
other
Santa Monica, CA 90401

title: Guest House OPEN 12pm-2pm
description:
Santa Monica Conservancy docents share the rich history of the Beach House site from the 1920s onward.
Free 20-minute visits docent tours are available on a walk-up basis, for groups of up to six people on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays from 12pm  2pm. Just head to the Marion Davies Guest House where you will be greeted by a docent. Please note masks are required while indoors.
Schedule subject to change, call Guest Services at 310-458-4904 to confirm dates and hours.
address:
415 Pacific Coast Highway
Santa Monica, CA 90402
(34.024715, -118.512795)

title: English as s Second Language (ESL) Conversation, Low
description:
Santa Monica Public Library hosts an ongoing series of English as a Second Language (ESL) classes taught by Adult Education Center instructors. Classes are free and students must be 18 years or older to attend. Community parents and SMMUSD parents have priority enrollment. Learn more about California adult education at caladulted.org.

Enrollment is through the Santa Monica-Malibu Unified School District Adult Education Center, located at 2510 Lincoln Blvd., Room 203, Santa Monica, CA, 90405. Visit smmusd.asapconnected.com or contact Olga Saucedo at osaucedo@smmusd.org or (310) 664-6222, ext.76203 to enroll.

Classes will begin in a virtual format. If live classes become possible, they will take place at Main Library, 601 Santa Monica Blvd.
address:
Virtual
Santa Monica, CA 90401

description: The Rent Control Board meets to conduct business associated with the Rent Control Charter Amendment and Regulations.

title: Clean Beaches & Ocean Committee Meeting (Special)
description: A remote special meeting of the Clean Beaches & Ocean Parcel Tax Citizens' Oversight Committee. An agenda will be posted online closer to the meeting date (Click on More Details).

title: Landmarks Commission Meeting
description: Established in 1975, the mission of the Landmarks Commission is To protect improvements and areas which represent the City's cultural, social, economic, political and architectural history; safeguard the City's historic, aesthetic and cultural heritage; and promote the use of landmarks and historic districts for the education, pleasure and welfare of the people.

title: Citizenship Class
description:
Santa Monica Public Library hosts this ongoing series of citizenship classes taught by Adult Education Center instructors. Classes are free and students must be 18 years or older to attend. Community parents and SMMUSD parents have priority enrollment.

The classes help students complete and submit their U.S. citizenship applications and prepare them for the official review.

Classes will begin in a virtual format. If live classes become possible, they will take place at the Pico Branch Library, 2201 Pico Blvd.

Enrollment is through the SMMUSD Adult Education Center located at 2510 Lincoln Blvd., Room 203, Santa Monica, CA, 90405
Contact Olga Saucedo at (310) 664-6222, ext.76203 or osaucedo@smmusd.org to enroll.

title: Planning Commission
description: Established in 1946, the Planning Commission envisions Santa Monica as a city of wellbeing, sustainability, and equity, and seeks to balance the many needs and priorities within our community in accordance with the Citys General Plan and Specific Plans. The Commission acts through open and civil discourse that is informed by public input, impartial analysis, and best practices in land use and planning.

title: Commission on Sustainability, Environmental Justice, and the Environment
description:
The Task Force on the Environment was established in 1991 by the Santa Monica City Council to advise City Council on environmental program and policy issues. The Task Force on the Environment was the driving force behind the development of Santa Monicas Sustainable City Plan in the early 1990s and continues to closely monitor the plan and advise Council on plan implementation. On July 27, 2021, the Task Force became a permenant commission named the Commission on Sustainability, Environmental Justice, and the Environment.

The Commission is an expert panel made up of seven members selected by City Council. Commissioners must have significant expertise in one or more areas of environmental policy and must reside or work in Santa Monica.
address:
other
Santa Monica, CA 90401

title: Architectural Review Board Meeting
description: The Architectural Review Board established in 1974, acts to preserve existing areas of natural beauty, cultural importance and assure that buildings, structures, signs or other developments are in good taste, good design, harmonious with surrounding developments, and in general contribute to the preservation of Santa Monica's reputation as a place of beauty, spaciousness and quality.

title: CANCELLED: Planning Commission
description: Established in 1946, the Planning Commission envisions Santa Monica as a city of wellbeing, sustainability, and equity, and seeks to balance the many needs and priorities within our community in accordance with the Citys General Plan and Specific Plans. The Commission acts through open and civil discourse that is informed by public input, impartial analysis, and best practices in land use and planning.

title: CANCELED Commission on Sustainability, Environ. Justice, and the Environment
description:
The Task Force on the Environment was established in 1991 by the Santa Monica City Council to advise City Council on environmental program and policy issues. The Task Force on the Environment was the driving force behind the development of Santa Monicas Sustainable City Plan in the early 1990s and continues to closely monitor the plan and advise Council on plan implementation. On July 27, 2021, the Task Force became a permenant commission named the Commission on Sustainability, Environmental Justice, and the Environment.

The Commission is an expert panel made up of seven members selected by City Council. Commissioners must have significant expertise in one or more areas of environmental policy and must reside or work in Santa Monica.

title: SM Reads Special Event: Emma Donoghue on The Pull of the Stars
description:
Award-winning writer Emma Donoghue's timely story about the Great Flu of 1918 takes place in a maternity ward when Ireland is doubly ravaged by war and disease. Over three brutal days, three women come together to support patients and one another in unexpected ways. Join us for this virtual author presentation and discussion about living through unprecedented times.
Access program at bit.ly/32FOHUz. The event is part of Santa Monica Reads. Learn more at smpl.org/smr.
address:
Virtual

title: Commission on Sustainability, Environmental Justice, and the Environment
description:
The Task Force on the Environment was established in 1991 by the Santa Monica City Council to advise City Council on environmental program and policy issues. The Task Force on the Environment was the driving force behind the development of Santa Monicas Sustainable City Plan in the early 1990s and continues to closely monitor the plan and advise Council on plan implementation. On July 27, 2021, the Task Force became a permenant commission named the Commission on Sustainability, Environmental Justice, and the Environment.

The Commission is an expert panel made up of seven members selected by City Council. Commissioners must have significant expertise in one or more areas of environmental policy and must reside or work in Santa Monica.

title: Task Force on the Environment Meeting
description:
The Task Force on the Environment was established in 1991 by the Santa Monica City Council to advise City Council on environmental program and policy issues. The Task Force on the Environment was the driving force behind the development of Santa Monicas Sustainable City Plan in the early 1990s and continues to closely monitor the plan and advise Council on plan implementation.

The Task Force is an expert panel made up of seven members selected by City Council with no fixed terms. Task Force members must have significant expertise in one or more areas of environmental policy and must reside or work in Santa Monica.

other
Santa Monica, CA 90401

title: Architectural Review Board Meeting
description: The Architectural Review Board established in 1974, acts to preserve existing areas of natural beauty, cultural importance and assure that buildings, structures, signs or other developments are in good taste, good design, harmonious with surrounding developments, and in general contribute to the preservation of Santa Monica's reputation as a place of beauty, spaciousness and quality.

title: Art and Design at Fire Station 1
description:
The Santa Monica Public Library and Santa Monica Cultural Affairs invites you to a conversation to mark the one-year anniversary of the new Fire Station 1 facility.

Join Architect Rob Quigley, Artist Deborah Aschheim and Santa Monica Deputy Fire Chief Tom Clemo as they discuss the innovative open design that (when the pandemic allows) invites the public into the heart of the building, the architect's work integrating art, design and function, and the multifaceted artwork entitled 'Back Story' that was the result of Aschheim's multi-year embedded residency in the life of the fire station. #ArtSaMo

title: SM Reads Special Event: Voices from COVIDs Front Lines
description:
Join us for a virtual discussion about healthcare and resiliency during COVID-19. Panelists include Dr. Dinora B. Chinchilla, a board-certified UCI Health Pulmonary Specialist and Jill Ruiz Carreon, a Ward Clerk Transcriber, who provides nursing staff support at Kaiser West LA. The conversation will be moderated by Lindsay B. Call, MPH, Santa Monicas COVID-19 Emergency Operations Center (EOC) Director.
Register in advance at bit.ly/2QP08GI. This event is part of Santa Monica Reads. Learn more at smpl.org/smr.

title: Downbeat 720
description:
Downbeat 720, the Citys long-running open-mic for high school performers, returns for its nineteenth year in a new all virtual format. Students are invited to perform their music, poetry, comedy or art for participating students and professional artist mentors. Performers will receive positive constructive feedback to help strengthen their performances.

Due to the current health crisis, and current restrictions on gathering to reduce the spread of COVID-19, its a time of isolation for everyone, including young adults. Downbeat 720 offers them a safe and supportive space for creative self-expression. All Santa Monica high school students are invited to join this supportive community of aspiring artists!

Participants can join at 7 p.m. for a virtual meet-and-greet, with the official program running from 7:20 to 9 p.m. Participants must register in advance.

title: The Campus Color Line
description:
UCLA Education Professor Eddie Coles 2020 book The Campus Color Line studies how college presidents in the 1960s responded to the Civil Rights Movement. The dramatic central chapter focuses on UCLA, with its president caught between UC system head Clark Kerr, who attempted to ban student political organizing, and the student government, who voted to send bail money to classmates who had been jailed in Mississippi as Freedom Riders. Dr. Cole will discuss this and other fascinating stories and connect them to the present.
This program will be held on Zoom. Register at http://bit.ly/3lpmycO

Virtual
Santa Monica, CA 90401

title: Task Force on the Environment Meeting (CANCELLED)
description:
The Task Force on the Environment was established in 1991 by the Santa Monica City Council to advise City Council on environmental program and policy issues. The Task Force on the Environment was the driving force behind the development of Santa Monicas Sustainable City Plan in the early 1990s and continues to closely monitor the plan and advise Council on plan implementation.

The Task Force is an expert panel made up of seven members selected by City Council with no fixed terms. Task Force members must have significant expertise in one or more areas of environmental policy and must reside or work in Santa Monica.

title: Wade in the Water, a tiny film fest
description:
Hello Community! Please join us on Juneteenth for Wade in the Water: A Tiny Film Fest featuring the premiere of BELONGING, a Belmar History + Art site-specific film honoring early African Americans in Santa Monica. This in-person outdoor screening of short films celebrates Black culture and the water. From spiritual rituals to migration and sports, water is an integral part of how we rejuvenate and restore joy.

Before the screening, enjoy food trucks, music by DJ Moni Vargas, and the history panels and sculpture that make up the Belmar History + Art exhibition. At the close of the event, stick around for a prize giveaway!

Bring your blankets or beach chairs for lounging on the field. Limited seating will be provided for accessibility.

Please note we will be following the COVID County Health public health and safety guidelines that are in place at the time of the event.

Field Entrance: On 4th Street between Olympic and Pico Blvds., at 1840 4th Street, Santa Monica CA 90401

$5 Parking: Civic Center Parking Structure, corner of 4th Street and Olympic Blvd. Santa Monica, CA 90401

Metro: 8 minute walk from the Downtown Santa Monica Station

#ArtSaMo #BelmarHistoryArt #Juneteenth
address:
other
Santa Monica, CA 90401

title: Montana Book Discussion Group: Girl, Woman, Other
description: Read and discuss this richly textured social novel by Bernardine Evaristo, winner of the 2019 Booker Prize and the first black woman to receive this highest literary honor in the English language. Girl, Woman, Other is a magnificent portrayal of the intersections of identity and a moving and hopeful story of an interconnected group of Black British women that paints a vivid portrait of the state of contemporary Britain and looks back to the legacy of Britains colonial history in Africa and the Caribbean.

title: Montana Book Discussion Group: Courting Mr. Lincoln
description:
Read and discuss this page-turning literary historical novel about the relationships between the brilliant, melancholic future President and the two people who knew him best: his handsome and charming confidant (and roommate) Joshua Speed and the spirited young debutante Mary Todd.

Author Louis Bayard is a New York Times Notable Book author and has been shortlisted for both the Edgar and Dagger awards for his historical thrillers, which include The Pale Blue Eye and Mr. Timothy. He lives in Washington, DC, and teaches at George Washington University. Visit him online at www.louisbayard.com.
address:
Virtual
Santa Monica, CA 90401

title: Task Force on the Environment Meeting
description:
The Task Force on the Environment was established in 1991 by the Santa Monica City Council to advise City Council on environmental program and policy issues. The Task Force on the Environment was the driving force behind the development of Santa Monicas Sustainable City Plan in the early 1990s and continues to closely monitor the plan and advise Council on plan implementation.

The Task Force is an expert panel made up of seven members selected by City Council with no fixed terms. Task Force members must have significant expertise in one or more areas of environmental policy and must reside or work in Santa Monica.

To join, select from the following options:

1) Web Browser
a)https://primetime.bluejeans.com/a2m/live-event/xztjzecc

2)Joining via a mobile device?
a) Open this link : https://primetime.bluejeans.com/a2m/live-event/xztjzecc
b) Download the app if you dont have it already.
c) Enter event ID : xztjzecc

3) Phone
Dial one of the following numbers, enter the participant PIN followed by # to confirm:

+1 (415) 466-7000 (US)
PIN 6527008 #

PIN 1895424347 #

title: Beginner's Chinese Calligraphy Workshop
description:
Chinese calligraphy is one of the most traditional art forms in the world, truly representative of eastern art and culture. In this workshop, Jojo Liu teaches traditional Chinese calligraphy basics including how to hold a brush, write basic strokes, and write while standing. The first 20 registrants will receive a free starter kit including a brush, ink, and paper.

Jojo Liu was taught and inspired by her grandfather to practice Chinese calligraphy from a young age. With her love and passion for creative arts, she adopts a modern twist to traditional Chinese calligraphy. Her work showcases a perfect balance of traditional calligraphy art with modern flare. She hopes to continue to spread the passion of Chinese calligraphy as a modern art form. She is a current board member for the San Francisco Chinese Arts Association (舊金山中華藝術學會); also, a member of the American Artist Association (美國藝術家協會). Her Instagram is jojo_calligraphy

title: Downbeat 720
description:
Downbeat 720, the Citys long-running open-mic for high school performers, returns for its nineteenth year in a new all virtual format. Students are invited to perform their music, poetry, comedy or art for participating students and professional artist mentors. Performers will receive positive constructive feedback to help strengthen their performances.

Due to the current health crisis, and current restrictions on gathering to reduce the spread of COVID-19, its a time of isolation for everyone, including young adults. Downbeat 720 offers them a safe and supportive space for creative self-expression. All Santa Monica high school students are invited to join this supportive community of aspiring artists!

Participants can join at 7 p.m. for a virtual meet-and-greet, with the official program running from 7:20 to 9 p.m. Participants must register in advance.

title: Montana Book Discussion Group: The Great Influenza
description:
The strongest weapon against pandemic is the truth. Read why in the definitive account of the 1918 Flu Epidemic.

Magisterial in its breadth of perspective and depth of research, The Great Influenza provides us with a precise and sobering model as we confront the current pandemic. As Barry concludes, 'The final lesson of 1918, a simple one yet one most difficult to execute, is that...those in authority must retain the public's trust. The way to do that is to distort nothing, to put the best face on nothing, to try to manipulate no one. Lincoln said that first, and best. A leader must make whatever horror exists concrete. Only then will people be able to break it apart.'

John M. Barry is the author of four previous books: Rising Tide: The Great Mississippi Flood of 1927 and How It Changed Amer­ica; Power Plays: Politics, Football, and Other Blood Sports; The Transformed Cell: Unlocking the Mysteries of Cancer (cowritten with Steven Rosenberg); and The Ambition and the Power: A True Story of Washington. He lives in New Orleans and Wash­ington, D.C.

Virtual
Santa Monica, CA 90401

title: Downbeat 720
description:
Downbeat 720, the Citys long-running open-mic for high school performers, returns for its nineteenth year in a new all virtual format. Students are invited to perform their music, poetry, comedy or art for participating students and professional artist mentors. Performers will receive positive constructive feedback to help strengthen their performances.

Due to the current health crisis, and current restrictions on gathering to reduce the spread of COVID-19, its a time of isolation for everyone, including young adults. Downbeat 720 offers them a safe and supportive space for creative self-expression. All Santa Monica high school students are invited to join this supportive community of aspiring artists!

Participants can join at 7 p.m. for a virtual meet-and-greet, with the official program running from 7:20 to 9 p.m. Participants must register in advance.

title: Celebración de César Chávez / César Chávez Celebration
description:
Familias Latinas Unidas (FLU) lo invita a unirse a la celebración en línea delcumpleaños de César Chávez con una presentación especial con líderes delmovimiento de trabajadores agrícolas. Aprenda sobre el trayecto de César Chávez
de trabajador a activista y escucha a un trabajador agícola actual.
Regístrese con anticipación para esta reunión: http://bit.ly/3qvStcG
Después de registrarse, recibirá un correo electrónico de confirmación con el enlace. El evento se presentará en español con interpretación al inglés.

Familias Latinas Unidas (FLU) invites you to join in celebrating Cesar Chavezs birthday online with special presentations by past and present leaders in the farm worker movement. Learn about Cesar Chavezs journey from worker to activist and hear from a present day farm worker.
Register in advance for this meeting: http://bit.ly/3qvStcG
After registering, you will receive a confirmation email containing information about joining the meeting. The event will be presented in Spanish with English interpretation available.

title: Virtual Julia Morgan Legacy Event
description:
Join Morgan scholar Karen McNeill, Ph.D. for her talk, Julia Morgan and the Men Who Built Hearst Castle, commemorating architect Julia Morgan, Californias first licensed woman architect. Morgan designed the Guest House and pool, which comprise the historic core of the Beach House. This talk is presented by the Annenberg Community Beach House and Santa Monica Conservancy.

title: Montana Book Discussion Group: Counter Culture
description:
Being a former waitress herself, it's not surprising that oral historian/photographer Candacy Taylor turned her attention to 'lifers'--the over-50 career waitresses who often are the heart and soul of a coffee shop or diner. After conducting interviews with 57 waitresses in 38 cities and towns across the U.S., the author found these women to be satisfied with their lives and proud of their job skills and occupation. Besides presenting portraits of some of these women (in both words and photos), Taylor looks at how female servers came to dominate coffee shops and diners; at the nuts and bolts of waitressing; and at the stereotypes that the larger culture has about waitresses. Delightful, thought provoking, and generously illustrated with the author's color photographs, this book will be appreciated by any reader who has eaten at a 'real' diner.

Candacy Taylor is an award-winning author, photographer and cultural documentarian. Her work has been featured in over 50 media outlets including the New Yorker and The Atlantic. She is the recipient of numerous fellowships and grants including The Hutchins Center for African & African American Research at Harvard University and the National Endowment for the Humanities.

title: Downbeat 720
description:
Downbeat 720, the Citys long-running open-mic for high school performers, returns for its nineteenth year in a new all virtual format. Students are invited to perform their music, poetry, comedy or art for participating students and professional artist mentors. Performers will receive positive constructive feedback to help strengthen their performances.

Due to the current health crisis, and current restrictions on gathering to reduce the spread of COVID-19, its a time of isolation for everyone, including young adults. Downbeat 720 offers them a safe and supportive space for creative self-expression. All Santa Monica high school students are invited to join this supportive community of aspiring artists!

Participants can join at 7 p.m. for a virtual meet-and-greet, with the official program running from 7:20 to 9 p.m. Participants must register in advance.

title: Historic Belmar Park Virtual Grand Opening
description:
Sunday Feb 28, 3:00-4:30pm PST Zoom event

The City of Santa Monica invites you to a virtual grand opening event to unveil Historic Belmar Park, Santa Monica's newest open space, and the dedicated artwork, signage and other elements of the Belmar History + Art project. The park and interpretive artwork commemorate a site that was home to a thriving African American community in the 1950s and honors the legacy of the historic Belmar neighborhood's contributions to Santa Monica life.

Belmar History + Art (BH+A) is a project of the City of Santa Monica, commissioned through its Percent for Art Program and made possible by Santa Monica Cultural Affairs and the City of Santa Monica's Public Works Department. A commemoration and celebration of the African American neighborhoods of the Belmar neighborhood and surrounding areas, and their contributions to the city's history and cultural heritage, BH+A includes a permanent exhibition with historical interpretive panels and a sculptural artwork, and an education program. The project was inspired in part by a mandate of the California Coastal Commission to 'integrate the principles of environmental justice, equality, and social equity.' Visit the BH+A website at www.santamonica.gov/arts/belmar for more information.

title: #ProjectBlackSpace - In Pursuit of Justice and Joy
description:
A Belmar History + Art event
Monday Feb 15, 7:30-9pm PST on YouTube

View this slideshow of photographs of early African American communities in Santa Monica and student artwork from April Banks' virtual residency at Sam Francis Gallery, featuring photographs compiled for the Belmar History + Art project.

The Site:
Now closed, the Civic Auditorium was one of the major city developments that displaced the former community of Belmar (1900s-1950s) through eminent domain. By projecting on the facade, I aim to shine a light on this hidden history.

The Project:
Belmar History + Art (BH+A) is a project of the City of Santa Monica, commissioned through its Percent for Art Program and made possible by Santa Monica Cultural Affairs and the City of Santa Monicas Public Works Department. A commemoration and celebration of the African American neighborhoods of the Belmar neighborhood and surrounding areas, and their contributions to the city's history and cultural heritage, BH+A includes a permanent exhibition with historical interpretive panels and a sculptural artwork, and an education program. The project was inspired in part by a mandate of the California Coastal Commission to 'integrate the principles of environmental justice, equality, and social equity.' Visit the BH+A website at www.santamonica.gov/arts/belmar#events for more information.

King, takes readers on a journey exploring
trauma, friendships, and secrets that intertwine
two Southside Chicago families for three
generations. This free event is part of the City's
Black History Month programming.

Santa Monica, CA 90401

title: Catherine Adel West Discusses Saving Ruby King
description: Author Catherine Adel West joins the Santa Monica community for a book reading and conversation about her debut novel, Saving Ruby King, which explores trauma, friendships and secrets that intertwine families for generations. Digital and print copies of Saving Ruby King are available through the Santa Monica Public Library. To check out a copy, visit smpl.org. Need a Library card? Sign up at smpl.org/Getting_a_Card.aspx. This event is part of the 2021 Black History Month event lineup.

title: Downbeat 720
description:
Downbeat 720, the Citys long-running open-mic for high school performers, returns for its nineteenth year in a new all virtual format. Students are invited to perform their music, poetry, comedy or art for participating students and professional artist mentors. Performers will receive positive constructive feedback to help strengthen their performances.

Due to the current health crisis, and current restrictions on gathering to reduce the spread of COVID-19, its a time of isolation for everyone, including young adults. Downbeat 720 offers them a safe and supportive space for creative self-expression. All Santa Monica high school students are invited to join this supportive community of aspiring artists!

Participants can join at 7 p.m. for a virtual meet-and-greet, with the official program running from 7:20 to 9 p.m. Participants must register in advance.

title: The Black Family: Representation, Identity and Diversity
description: Join us for the Black History Month 2021 opening ceremony on Rosa Parks Day. The event will feature a discussion by local families highlighting the diversity, identity and history of Santa Monicas Black community. There will also be special dance performances and small segments highlighting the cooking traditions of Black families. RSVP required.

title: Planning Commission
description: Established in 1946, the Planning Commission envisions Santa Monica as a city of wellbeing, sustainability, and equity, and seeks to balance the many needs and priorities within our community in accordance with the City's General Plan and Specific Plans. The Commission acts through open and civil discourse that is informed by public input, impartial analysis, and best practices in land use and planning.

description: Join us for a mix of low-intensity and high-intensity moves for an interval-style, calorie-burning dance fitness party as part of our Black History Month 2021 celebration. People of all ages and fitness levels are welcome to join. RSVP required.

title: Planning Commission
description: Established in 1946, the Planning Commission envisions Santa Monica as a city of wellbeing, sustainability, and equity, and seeks to balance the many needs and priorities within our community in accordance with the City's General Plan and Specific Plans. The Commission acts through open and civil discourse that is informed by public input, impartial analysis, and best practices in land use and planning.

title: The Disabilities Commission Regular Meeting
description: The Disabilities Commission helps improve the quality of life for people with disabilities in Santa Monica by prioritizing issues of concern and advising the City Council and City Staff on those issues. The Commission recommends ways to maximize participation of people with disabilities in all facets of City life and increase awareness of the abilities, rights and issues of people with disabilities throughout the community.

title: Downbeat 720
description:
Downbeat 720, the Citys long-running open-mic for high school performers, returns for its nineteenth year in a new all virtual format. Students are invited to perform their music, poetry, comedy or art for participating students and professional artist mentors. Performers will receive positive constructive feedback to help strengthen their performances.

Due to the current health crisis, and current restrictions on gathering to reduce the spread of COVID-19, its a time of isolation for everyone, including young adults. Downbeat 720 offers them a safe and supportive space for creative self-expression. All Santa Monica high school students are invited to join this supportive community of aspiring artists!

Participants can join at 7 p.m. for a virtual meet-and-greet, with the official program running from 7:20 to 9 p.m. Participants must register in advance.

title: Main Library Book Group
description:
The Devils Highway: A True Story by Luis Alberto Urrea.

The author of 'Across the Wire' offers brilliant investigative reporting of what went wrong when, in May 2001, a group of 26 men attempted to cross the Mexican border into the desert of southern Arizona. Only 12 men came back out. 'Superb . . . Nothing less than a saga on the scale of the Exodus and an ordeal as heartbreaking as the Passion . . . The book comes vividly alive with a richness of language and a mastery of narrative detail that only the most gifted of writers are able to achieve.--'Los Angeles Times Book Review.'

college where her husband taught are both
shuttered, Willa Knox starts researching their

repairs. Her research leads to the discovery that a
previous owner's battles parallel her own.

title: Montana Book Discussion Group: The River of Doubt
description: Historian Candice Millard records Theodore Roosevelts exploration of a hitherto uncharted river in the heart of the Mato Grosso. A confluence of circumstances, including a South American speaking tour and the eagerness of others to investigate the Amazonian headwaters, brought Teddy, aged 55 and still bold and plucky, to Brazil, then largely unmapped and unknown. When the opportunity came to change a planned route to follow the uncharted course of the ominously named River of Doubt, the former chief executive seized it eagerly. And so, with devoted son Kermit and truly intrepid Brazilian co-commander Cândido Rondon, along with a band of hardy recruits, the party plunged into the fierce, fecund jungle and its unknown dangers. (Its an exploit that standard TR biographies generally treat lightly, if at all). With heavy, useless equipment and inappropriate provisions, the Roosevelt-Rondon Expedition ventured into the luxuriant wilderness where every life form threatened. There were pit vipers, piranhas and tiny fish that attack where a man is most vulnerable. There were poisonous plants, malevolent insect swarms and native warriors, ever present and never seen Eventually Colonel Roosevelt was downed by injury and fever. He ended his journey emaciated at three-quarters of the weight he started with on the watercourse now found in atlases as the Roosevelt River. (from Kirkus Reviews)

title: Santa Monica Certified Farmer's Market (Downtown - Wednesday)
description: Fresh seasonal produce sold direct from California farmers. The inaugural Santa Monica Farmers Market opened Wednesday July 11, 1981 in Santa Monica's downtown retail district with goals of providing reasonably priced, high quality produce to the city's population, and bringing more foot traffic into the downtown area. The Wednesday market met with instant success in its first year. Today, the Wednesday Farmers Market is widely recognized as one of the largest and most diverse grower-only CFM's in the nation. Some nine thousands food shoppers, and many of Los Angeles' best known chefs and restaurants, are keyed to the seasonal rhythms of the weekly Wednesday Market.

title: Cooking with the Market Chef
description:
MAIN STREET FARMERS MARKET - COOKING WITH THE MARKET CHEF
2640 Main Street @ Ocean Park

Join us the 2nd Sunday of each month at 10 am, 11 am and noon, at the Main Street Farmers Market for Cooking with the Market Chef - seasonal farm to table cooking demonstrations and shopping tips with Kim Vu owner of Vucacious Catering. Each month we will featured a different theme and farmer from the market. Free recipes and food samples.

February - Valentines Dinner at Home, featuring Santa Barbara Channel Island Seafood and McFarlin Family Farms
March - Vegan Meals by Famous Female Chefs, featuring Smith Family Farms
April - Cooking for Easter, featuring Jimenez Family Farms
May - Brunch on a Budget, featuring Anna's Family Farm
June - BBQ Dishes for Summer, featuring Apricot Lane Farms
July - Making the Perfect Picnic Basket, featuring Olson Family Farms and Suncoast Farm
August - Everything Tomatoes, featuring Country Rhodes Family Farm
September - Reducing Food Waste, featuring Sunrise Organic Farms
October - It's Squash Time, farm TBD
November - Thanksgiving Side Dishes, featuring Terry Ranch and Cuyama Orchards
December - Healthy Delicious Foods for the Holidays, featuring Sunrise Organic Farms

Demos are held in the center of the market at 10 am, 11 am and noon unless otherwise noted. All demos are free and open to the public.

Note: Demos and the markets are subject cancellation due to negative environmental conditions, extreme weather or poor air quality. Check our social media accounts for regular updates @smfms

title: Commission on the Status of Women Regular Meeting
description: The purpose of the Commission on the Status of Women is to enhance the status of women in our community. The Commission will promote these goals through investigation of, advocacy for, and policy development regarding issues relevant to women and girls, and by creating leadership and career advancement opportunities for women and girls in our community.

title: Planning Commission
description: Established in 1946, the Planning Commission envisions Santa Monica as a city of wellbeing, sustainability, and equity, and seeks to balance the many needs and priorities within our community in accordance with the City's General Plan and Specific Plans. The Commission acts through open and civil discourse that is informed by public input, impartial analysis, and best practices in land use and planning.

title: Santa Monica Certified Farmer's Market (Downtown - Wednesday)
description: Fresh seasonal produce sold direct from California farmers. The inaugural Santa Monica Farmers Market opened Wednesday July 11, 1981 in Santa Monica's downtown retail district with goals of providing reasonably priced, high quality produce to the city's population, and bringing more foot traffic into the downtown area. The Wednesday market met with instant success in its first year. Today, the Wednesday Farmers Market is widely recognized as one of the largest and most diverse grower-only CFM's in the nation. Some nine thousands food shoppers, and many of Los Angeles' best known chefs and restaurants, are keyed to the seasonal rhythms of the weekly Wednesday Market.
address:
1351 Third Street Promenade
Santa Monica, CA 90401
(34.017004, -118.497684)

title: December Street Sweeping 12/8-12/11
description:
Santa Monica's street sweeping operation will be conducted during the first full week of the month through the end of 2020. The City will continue to monitor health guidelines and service needs and may modify its operations if necessary.
Please observe the 'No Parking' street signs for the specific street sweeping dates on your street. For example, if the 'No Parking' sign indicates parking is prohibited on Tuesdays, please do not park on the street on Tuesday, 9/8, 10/6, 11/3, and 12/8 during the designated times.
address:
other
Santa Monica, CA 90401

title: Downbeat 720
description:
Downbeat 720, the Citys long-running open-mic for high school performers, returns for its nineteenth year in a new all virtual format. Students are invited to perform their music, poetry, comedy or art for participating students and professional artist mentors. Performers will receive positive constructive feedback to help strengthen their performances.

Due to the current health crisis, and current restrictions on gathering to reduce the spread of COVID-19, its a time of isolation for everyone, including young adults. Downbeat 720 offers them a safe and supportive space for creative self-expression. All Santa Monica high school students are invited to join this supportive community of aspiring artists!

Participants can join at 7 p.m. for a virtual meet-and-greet, with the official program running from 7:20 to 9 p.m. Participants must register in advance.

title: The Disabilities Commission Regular Meeting
description: The Disabilities Commission helps improve the quality of life for people with disabilities in Santa Monica by prioritizing issues of concern and advising the City Council and City Staff on those issues. The Commission recommends ways to maximize participation of people with disabilities in all facets of City life and increase awareness of the abilities, rights and issues of people with disabilities throughout the community.

title: Santa Monica Certified Farmers Market (Main St.)
description: 'The ULTIMATE community gathering. Great for family, food and fun!' The Sunday Main Street Farmers Market is a well balanced blend of Certified California Farmers, tasty prepared and packaged foods, entertainment and children's activities as well as local retail. Attended by over 5000 customers each weekend this 'ultimate community gathering' has become an integral and cherished part of life for many local residents. The Main Street market hosts a variety activities including bands, a bi-weekly cooking demonstrations, arts and crafts, a face painter, a balloon animal designer as well as seasonal California grown fruits, vegetables, nuts, meats and cheeses.

title: Saturday Certified Farmer's Market (Virginia Ave. Park)
description:
Fresh seasonal produce sold direct by Californias farmers! The Saturday Pico Farmers Market was established in March 1992. It is a family market in the heart of the Pico neighborhood and adjacent to the Pico Library. This market offers a variety of organic and conventionally-grown produce, in addition to several prepared food options, coffee and musical entertainment. This market also partners with Hunger Action LA to offer Market Match incentives for WIC, CalFresh, SDI and SSI customers.

Parking for the market is available in the lot along Pico Blvd., at meters along Pico Blvd. or adjacent to Virginia Park in the parking lot on north/east corner of Pico and Cloverfield.

title: Author Talk: Norma Mendoza-Denton, Ph.D. on Language in the Trump Era
description:
Using many detailed examples, Dr. Mendoza-Dentons fascinating and highly topical book reveals how Trump's rallying cries, boasts, accusations, and mockery enlist many of his supporters into his alternate reality. Join us for a virtual presentation and discussion about the mechanisms by which language in the Trump era has widened social divisions.
Register via Zoom: zoom.us/meeting/register/tZIld-2vqTIuHdQY6kJUSWeZnUdt91pYNB7G

title: Montana Book Discussion Group: The Sisters
description: In prose so light that sentences nearly float up from the page, Mary S. Lovell chases the Mitford sisters (Nancy, Pamela, Diana, Unity, Jessica, and Deborah) hither and yon, from mansion to prison, from Hitlers hideaway to the top of the bestseller lists. Although there are indeed numerous family crises and catastrophes the story always rolls merrily along with little trenchant or compelling analysis of the meanings or effects of the events The much-chronicled Mitfords remain a family with astonishing histories. Diana and Unity were infatuated with fascism and charmed by Hitler (Lovell does not believe they ended up in the sack). Unity, in fact, was so alarmed when England and Germany went to war that she shot herself in the head, somehow survived, and, in Lovells words, remained childlike for the rest of her life. (Hitler, ever accommodating, paid all her medical bills and saw that she got safely to Switzerland.) Back in England, Diana, whom the government considered a security threat, sat out three and a half years of the war in prison Jessicadenied an education by her parents (who saw no point in it for young women)rebelled by becoming a Communist and later emigrated to America, where, after becoming a citizen, she found herself being grilled by the California Un-American Activities Committee. (from Kirkus Reviews)

title: Main Library Book Group
description:
There There by Tommy Orange.

Twelve Native Americans came to the Big Oakland Powwow for different reasons. Jacquie Red Feather is newly sober and trying to make it back to the family she left behind in shame. Dene Oxedrene is pulling his life together after his uncle's death and has come to work the powwow and to honor his uncle's memory. Edwin Frank has come to find his true father. Bobby Big Medicine has come to drum the Grand Entry. Opal Viola Victoria Bear Shield has come to watch her nephew Orvil Red Feather; Orvil has taught himself Indian dance through YouTube videos, and he has come to the powwow to dance in public for the very first time. Tony Loneman is a young Native American boy whose future seems destined to be as bleak as his past, and he has come to the Powwow with darker intentions--intentions that will destroy the lives of everyone in his path. Tommy Orange delivers a wondrous and shattering portrait of an America few of us have ever seen. A multi-generational, relentlessly paced story about violence and recovery, hope and loss, identity and power, dislocation and communion, and the beauty and despair woven into the history of a nation and its people.
address:
Offsite or Virtual Programs
Santa Monica, CA 90401

title: Commission on the Status of Women Regular Meeting
description: The purpose of the Commission on the Status of Women is to enhance the status of women in our community. The Commission will promote these goals through investigation of, advocacy for, and policy development regarding issues relevant to women and girls, and by creating leadership and career advancement opportunities for women and girls in our community.

title: Santa Monica Certified Farmer's Market (Downtown - Wednesday)
description: Fresh seasonal produce sold direct from California farmers. The inaugural Santa Monica Farmers Market opened Wednesday July 11, 1981 in Santa Monica's downtown retail district with goals of providing reasonably priced, high quality produce to the city's population, and bringing more foot traffic into the downtown area. The Wednesday market met with instant success in its first year. Today, the Wednesday Farmers Market is widely recognized as one of the largest and most diverse grower-only CFM's in the nation. Some nine thousands food shoppers, and many of Los Angeles' best known chefs and restaurants, are keyed to the seasonal rhythms of the weekly Wednesday Market.

title: Downbeat 720
description:
Downbeat 720, the Citys long-running open-mic for high school performers, returns for its nineteenth year in a new all virtual format. Students are invited to perform their music, poetry, comedy or art for participating students and professional artist mentors. Performers will receive positive constructive feedback to help strengthen their performances.

Due to the current health crisis, and current restrictions on gathering to reduce the spread of COVID-19, its a time of isolation for everyone, including young adults. Downbeat 720 offers them a safe and supportive space for creative self-expression. All Santa Monica high school students are invited to join this supportive community of aspiring artists!

Participants can join at 7 p.m. for a virtual meet-and-greet, with the official program running from 7:20 to 9 p.m. Participants must register in advance.

title: Zoning Administrator
description: The Zoning Administrator issues land use permits that are minor in nature and may adopt specific findings of fact to support the resulting decision, or require specific conditions. Some Zoning Administrator permits are administrative determinations, while others require a noticed public hearing.

title: Landmarks Commission Meeting
description: Established in 1975, the mission of the Landmarks Commission is To protect improvements and areas which represent the City's cultural, social, economic, political and architectural history; safeguard the City's historic, aesthetic and cultural heritage; and promote the use of landmarks and historic districts for the education, pleasure and welfare of the people.

title: Cooking with the Market Chef
description:
MAIN STREET FARMERS MARKET - COOKING WITH THE MARKET CHEF
2640 Main Street @ Ocean Park

Join us the 2nd Sunday of each month at 10 am, 11 am and noon, at the Main Street Farmers Market for Cooking with the Market Chef - seasonal farm to table cooking demonstrations and shopping tips with Kim Vu owner of Vucacious Catering. Each month we will featured a different theme and farmer from the market. Free recipes and food samples.

February - Valentines Dinner at Home, featuring Santa Barbara Channel Island Seafood and McFarlin Family Farms
March - Vegan Meals by Famous Female Chefs, featuring Smith Family Farms
April - Cooking for Easter, featuring Jimenez Family Farms
May - Brunch on a Budget, featuring Anna's Family Farm
June - BBQ Dishes for Summer, featuring Apricot Lane Farms
July - Making the Perfect Picnic Basket, featuring Olson Family Farms and Suncoast Farm
August - Everything Tomatoes, featuring Country Rhodes Family Farm
September - Reducing Food Waste, featuring Sunrise Organic Farms
October - It's Squash Time, farm TBD
November - Thanksgiving Side Dishes, featuring Terry Ranch and Cuyama Orchards
December - Healthy Delicious Foods for the Holidays, featuring Sunrise Organic Farms

Demos are held in the center of the market at 10 am, 11 am and noon unless otherwise noted. All demos are free and open to the public.

Note: Demos and the markets are subject cancellation due to negative environmental conditions, extreme weather or poor air quality. Check our social media accounts for regular updates @smfms
address:
Main Street
Santa Monica, CA 90401

title: Santa Monica Certified Farmers Market (Main St.)
description: 'The ULTIMATE community gathering. Great for family, food and fun!' The Sunday Main Street Farmers Market is a well balanced blend of Certified California Farmers, tasty prepared and packaged foods, entertainment and children's activities as well as local retail. Attended by over 5000 customers each weekend this 'ultimate community gathering' has become an integral and cherished part of life for many local residents. The Main Street market hosts a variety activities including bands, a bi-weekly cooking demonstrations, arts and crafts, a face painter, a balloon animal designer as well as seasonal California grown fruits, vegetables, nuts, meats and cheeses.

title: The Disabilities Commission Regular Meeting
description: The Disabilities Commission helps improve the quality of life for people with disabilities in Santa Monica by prioritizing issues of concern and advising the City Council and City Staff on those issues. title: Montana Book Discussion Group: Rules of Civility
description: Amor Towles' buzzed-about first novel is an affectionate return to the postJazz Age years, and the literary style that grew out of it (though seasoned with expletives). Brooklyn girl Katey Kontent and her boardinghouse mate, Midwestern beauty Eve Ross, are expert flirts who become an instant, inseparable threesome with mysterious young banker Tinker Grey. With him, they hit all the hot nightspots and consume much alcohol. After a milk truck mauls his roadster with the women in it, permanently scarring Eve, the guilt-ridden Tinker devotes himself to her, though he and she both know he has stronger feelings for Katey. Strong-willed Katey works her way up the career ladder, from secretarial job on Wall Street to publishers assistant at Condé Nast, forging friendships with society types and not allowing social niceties to stand in her way. Eve and Tinker grow apart, and then Kate, belatedly seeing Tinker for what he is, sadly gives up on him. (from Kirkus Reviews)

title: Main Library Book Group
description:
The Future of Capitalism by Paul Collier.

From world-renowned economist Paul Collier, a candid diagnosis of the many failures of the greatest economic system in history, and a pragmatic and realistic vision for how we can repair it. Western society, once thriving, is being torn apart by deep new rifts in its social and economic fabric. It's now populous cities versus rural counties; the highly skilled elite versus the less educated; wealthy versus developing countries. As these breaks have deepened, we've lost the sense of obligation to others so crucial to the rise of postwar social democracy in the first place. These divisions are currently being addressed solely by revivalist ideologies and populist megafigures--we're in the age of Brexit, President Donald Trump, and the return of the far right in Germany. And unless we do something now, the gap between the promises of prosperity for all that capitalism once offered and the crisis of contempt we find ourselves in will only grow wider, faster. [This book] is a passionate and polemical treatise that presents brilliantly original solutions for healing this economic, social, and cultural discord, with the cool head of pragmatism and policy rather than the fervor of rhetoric. Paul Collier's workable solution is in the center: we have no time for moral or intellectual superiority on either side of the political spectrum, he argues, and no shiny new economic theory is going to save us this time. Drawing on the wisdom of some of the world's most distinguished social scientists, Collier charts an agenda of empowerment to show us how to save capitalism from itself--eschewing the ideological baggage of the twentieth century and instead crafting practical policy grounded in communitarian ethics to address the rapid rise in inequality that will either end us or propel us into an entirely new economic age.

Offsite or Virtual Programs

title: Downbeat 720
description:
Downbeat 720, the Citys long-running open-mic for high school performers, returns for its nineteenth year in a new all virtual format. Students are invited to perform their music, poetry, comedy or art for participating students and professional artist mentors. Performers will receive positive constructive feedback to help strengthen their performances.

Due to the current health crisis, and current restrictions on gathering to reduce the spread of COVID-19, its a time of isolation for everyone, including young adults. Downbeat 720 offers them a safe and supportive space for creative self-expression. All Santa Monica high school students are invited to join this supportive community of aspiring artists!

Participants can join at 7 p.m. for a virtual meet-and-greet, with the official program running from 7:20 to 9 p.m. Participants must register in advance.

title: Cooking with the Market Chef
description:
MAIN STREET FARMERS MARKET - COOKING WITH THE MARKET CHEF
2640 Main Street @ Ocean Park

Join us the 2nd Sunday of each month at 10 am, 11 am and noon, at the Main Street Farmers Market for Cooking with the Market Chef - seasonal farm to table cooking demonstrations and shopping tips with Kim Vu owner of Vucacious Catering. Each month we will featured a different theme and farmer from the market. Free recipes and food samples.

February - Valentines Dinner at Home, featuring Santa Barbara Channel Island Seafood and McFarlin Family Farms
March - Vegan Meals by Famous Female Chefs, featuring Smith Family Farms
April - Cooking for Easter, featuring Jimenez Family Farms
May - Brunch on a Budget, featuring Anna's Family Farm
June - BBQ Dishes for Summer, featuring Apricot Lane Farms
July - Making the Perfect Picnic Basket, featuring Olson Family Farms and Suncoast Farm
August - Everything Tomatoes, featuring Country Rhodes Family Farm
September - Reducing Food Waste, featuring Sunrise Organic Farms
October - It's Squash Time, farm TBD
November - Thanksgiving Side Dishes, featuring Terry Ranch and Cuyama Orchards
December - Healthy Delicious Foods for the Holidays, featuring Sunrise Organic Farms

Demos are held in the center of the market at 10 am, 11 am and noon unless otherwise noted. All demos are free and open to the public.

Note: Demos and the markets are subject cancellation due to negative environmental conditions, extreme weather or poor air quality. Check our social media accounts for regular updates @smfms

title: Santa Monica Certified Farmer's Market (Downtown - Wednesday)
description: Fresh seasonal produce sold direct from California farmers. The inaugural Santa Monica Farmers Market opened Wednesday July 11, 1981 in Santa Monica's downtown retail district with goals of providing reasonably priced, high quality produce to the city's population, and bringing more foot traffic into the downtown area. The Wednesday market met with instant success in its first year. Today, the Wednesday Farmers Market is widely recognized as one of the largest and most diverse grower-only CFM's in the nation. Some nine thousands food shoppers, and many of Los Angeles' best known chefs and restaurants, are keyed to the seasonal rhythms of the weekly Wednesday Market.

Santa Monica, CA 90401

title: The Social Services Commission Regular Meeting
description: The mission of the Social Services Commission is to preserve and enhance the quality of life for all residents of the City of Santa Monica. Through ongoing dialogue, outreach, education and advocacy, the Social Services Commission will advise and assist the City Council and staff with needs assessment, priorities, planning, and budgetary implications for social service programs.

title: Montana Book Discussion Group: Where the Crawdads Sing
description: For years, rumors of the Marsh Girl have haunted Barkley Cove, a quiet town on the North Carolina coast. In late 1969, when handsome Chase Andrews is found dead, the locals immediately suspect Kya Clark, the so-called Marsh Girl. But Kya is not what they say. Sensitive and intelligent, she has survived for years alone in the marsh that she calls home. When two young men from town become intrigued by her wild beauty, Kya opens herself to a new life  until the unthinkable happens.

title: Cooking with the Market Chef
description:
MAIN STREET FARMERS MARKET - COOKING WITH THE MARKET CHEF
2640 Main Street @ Ocean Park

Join us the 2nd Sunday of each month at 10 am, 11 am and noon, at the Main Street Farmers Market for Cooking with the Market Chef - seasonal farm to table cooking demonstrations and shopping tips with Kim Vu owner of Vucacious Catering. Each month we will featured a different theme and farmer from the market. Free recipes and food samples.

February - Valentines Dinner at Home, featuring Santa Barbara Channel Island Seafood and McFarlin Family Farms
March - Vegan Meals by Famous Female Chefs, featuring Smith Family Farms
April - Cooking for Easter, featuring Jimenez Family Farms
May - Brunch on a Budget, featuring Anna's Family Farm
June - BBQ Dishes for Summer, featuring Apricot Lane Farms
July - Making the Perfect Picnic Basket, featuring Olson Family Farms and Suncoast Farm
August - Everything Tomatoes, featuring Country Rhodes Family Farm
September - Reducing Food Waste, featuring Sunrise Organic Farms
October - It's Squash Time, farm TBD
November - Thanksgiving Side Dishes, featuring Terry Ranch and Cuyama Orchards
December - Healthy Delicious Foods for the Holidays, featuring Sunrise Organic Farms

Demos are held in the center of the market at 10 am, 11 am and noon unless otherwise noted. All demos are free and open to the public.

Note: Demos and the markets are subject cancellation due to negative environmental conditions, extreme weather or poor air quality. Check our social media accounts for regular updates @smfms
address:
Main Street
Santa Monica, CA 90401

title: Sustainable Delivery Options for Restaurants
description:
Under the pandemic, restaurants are facing unprecedented challenges and relying on delivery more than ever. As part of the nations first-ever Zero Emissions Delivery Zone, The Los Angeles Cleantech Incubator and the City are hosting a virtual event on Green Delivery Solutions for Restaurants on September 2 from 9am  10am.

During this event, you'll learn about new delivery vehicles such as e-bikes, e-scooters and light electric vehicles that can help your restaurant expand delivery options. Learn how you can take control of your delivery options and lead the movement towards a zero emissions community.

Join here: https://us02web.zoom.us/j/84482612344#success

title: Updates to Temporary Use of Outdoor Areas Permit Program
description:
The City of Santa Monica recently updated its Temporary Use of Public and Private Outdoor Space program, and extended this free program through October 31. All participating businesses will need to renew or enter new agreements with the City by September 7.

City staff are available to answer questions, and will walk participants through program adjustments, including:

Overview of the new application process on CityGrows
Updated Dos and Donts of Temporary Use of Public Spaces
Public Health / Life & Safety Requirements for furnishings and materials for outdoor commercial use
Updated Tactical Parklet Manual, which includes criteria for opening parklets
Free Parklet materials offer to qualifying businesses
Q+A
Speakers
Jennifer Taylor, Economic Development Manager, City of Santa Monica
Jacqui Swartz, Transportation Planning Associate, City of Santa Monica
Kirsten Galler, Deputy City Attorney, City of Santa Monica

title: Mystery Book Group
description:
Featured August title: Where the Crawdads Sing by Delia Owens
For years, rumors of the Marsh Girl have haunted Barkley Cove, a quiet town on the North Carolina coast. In late 1969, when handsome Chase Andrews is found dead, the locals immediately suspect Kya Clark, the so-called Marsh Girl. But Kya is not what they say. Sensitive and intelligent, she has survived for years alone in the marsh that she calls home. When two young men from town become intrigued by her wild beauty, Kya opens herself to a new life  until the unthinkable happens. Register to attend this program by emailing karen.reitz@smgov.net.

title: Fiction Winners Book Group
description:
This book group reads and discusses prize-winning fiction, and meets the 3rd Saturday of the month.

Netherland by Joseph ONeill

In a post-9/11 New York City, Hans - a banker originally from the Netherlands - finds himself marooned among the strange occupants of the Chelsea Hotel after his English wife and son return to London. Alone and untethered, Hans stumbles upon the vibrant subculture of cricket, where he revisits his lost childhood and, thanks to a friendship with a charismatic and charming Trinidadian man, begins to reconnect with his life and his adopted country. Register to attend this program by emailing karen.reitz@smgov.net.

description: Established in 1946, the Planning Commission envisions Santa Monica as a city of wellbeing, sustainability, and equity, and seeks to balance the many needs and priorities within our community in accordance with the City's General Plan and Specific Plans. title: SM Reads Event: The Architecture of Los Angeles Central Library
description:
Join us for a discussion and visual presentation on the architectural history of the Los Angeles Central Library. Learn about the unique history of the building and the role the 1986 fire played in its redesign. Panelists include Kenneth Breisch, Associate Professor of Architecture at USC; Margaret Bach, founding member of the Los Angeles Conservancy; and Stephen Gee, author of Los Angeles Central Library: A History of Its Art and Architecture.

description:

The Master Gardeners of Los Angeles visit the Pico Farmers Market on the third Saturday of each month 9:30 am - Noon.

title: Cooking with the Market Chef
description:
MAIN STREET FARMERS MARKET - COOKING WITH THE MARKET CHEF
2640 Main Street @ Ocean Park

Join us the 2nd Sunday of each month at 10 am, 11 am and noon, at the Main Street Farmers Market for Cooking with the Market Chef - seasonal farm to table cooking demonstrations and shopping tips with Kim Vu owner of Vucacious Catering. Each month we will featured a different theme and farmer from the market. Free recipes and food samples.

February - Valentines Dinner at Home, featuring Santa Barbara Channel Island Seafood and McFarlin Family Farms
March - Vegan Meals by Famous Female Chefs, featuring Smith Family Farms
April - Cooking for Easter, featuring Jimenez Family Farms
May - Brunch on a Budget, featuring Anna's Family Farm
June - BBQ Dishes for Summer, featuring Apricot Lane Farms
July - Making the Perfect Picnic Basket, featuring Olson Family Farms and Suncoast Farm
August - Everything Tomatoes, featuring Country Rhodes Family Farm
September - Reducing Food Waste, featuring Sunrise Organic Farms
October - It's Squash Time, farm TBD
November - Thanksgiving Side Dishes, featuring Terry Ranch and Cuyama Orchards
December - Healthy Delicious Foods for the Holidays, featuring Sunrise Organic Farms

Demos are held in the center of the market at 10 am, 11 am and noon unless otherwise noted. All demos are free and open to the public.

Note: Demos and the markets are subject cancellation due to negative environmental conditions, extreme weather or poor air quality. Check our social media accounts for regular updates @smfms
address:
Main Street
Santa Monica, CA 90401

title: Santa Monica Certified Farmers Market (Main St.)
description: 'The ULTIMATE community gathering. Great for family, food and fun!' The Sunday Main Street Farmers Market is a well balanced blend of Certified California Farmers, tasty prepared and packaged foods, entertainment and children's activities as well as local retail. Attended by over 5000 customers each weekend this 'ultimate community gathering' has become an integral and cherished part of life for many local residents. The Main Street market hosts a variety activities including bands, a bi-weekly cooking demonstrations, arts and crafts, a face painter, a balloon animal designer as well as seasonal California grown fruits, vegetables, nuts, meats and cheeses.
address:
Main Street
Santa Monica, CA 90401

title: Saturday Certified Farmer's Market (Virginia Ave. Park)
description:
Fresh seasonal produce sold direct by Californias farmers! The Saturday Pico Farmers Market was established in March 1992. It is a family market in the heart of the Pico neighborhood and adjacent to the Pico Library. This market offers a variety of organic and conventionally-grown produce, in addition to several prepared food options, coffee and musical entertainment. This market also partners with Hunger Action LA to offer Market Match incentives for WIC, CalFresh, SDI and SSI customers.

Parking for the market is available in the lot along Pico Blvd., at meters along Pico Blvd. or adjacent to Virginia Park in the parking lot on north/east corner of Pico and Cloverfield.

title: Launch to College
description: Teens and parents of the classes of 2021 and 2022: During this time when most everything normal about the college admission cycle has been upended, join Teen LAUNCH for an in-depth look at your college-prep plan in the coming months. Nick Soper and Kristine Tye explain how to stay on top of a rapidly changing admissions landscape, how to make your time sheltering in place count for applications, and how the Teen LAUNCH summer college checklist will get you ahead of the game when senior year begins. Access the program here: https://primetime.bluejeans.com/a2m/live-event/gyzehrpd

title: Planning Commission
description: Established in 1946, the Planning Commission envisions Santa Monica as a city of wellbeing, sustainability, and equity, and seeks to balance the many needs and priorities within our community in accordance with the City's General Plan and Specific Plans. The Commission acts through open and civil discourse that is informed by public input, impartial analysis, and best practices in land use and planning.

title: Senior TAP Workshop at Ken Edwards Center
description: Bring valid ID showing you are 62 years or older to apply for a FREE senior reduced fare TAP card. Includes travel and TAP card use training. For details, visit bigbluebus.com/tapworkshop.

title: Santa Monica Certified Farmer's Market (Downtown - Wednesday)
description: Fresh seasonal produce sold direct from California farmers. The inaugural Santa Monica Farmers Market opened Wednesday July 11, 1981 in Santa Monica's downtown retail district with goals of providing reasonably priced, high quality produce to the city's population, and bringing more foot traffic into the downtown area. The Wednesday market met with instant success in its first year. Today, the Wednesday Farmers Market is widely recognized as one of the largest and most diverse grower-only CFM's in the nation. Some nine thousands food shoppers, and many of Los Angeles' best known chefs and restaurants, are keyed to the seasonal rhythms of the weekly Wednesday Market.
address:
1351 Third Street Promenade
Santa Monica, CA 90401
(34.017004, -118.497684)

title: Architectural Review Board Meeting
description: The Architectural Review Board established in 1974, acts to preserve existing areas of natural beauty, cultural importance and assure that buildings, structures, signs or other developments are in good taste, good design, harmonious with surrounding developments, and in general contribute to the preservation of Santa Monica's reputation as a place of beauty, spaciousness and quality.

title: The Disabilities Commission Regular Meeting
description: The Disabilities Commission helps improve the quality of life for people with disabilities in Santa Monica by prioritizing issues of concern and advising the City Council and City Staff on those issues. The Commission recommends ways to maximize participation of people with disabilities in all facets of City life and increase awareness of the abilities, rights and issues of people with disabilities throughout the community.

title: Online: Paper Puppet Animation with Matt Reynolds
description:
Sunday, 8/2 1-4pm
Cost:FREE
To register, click on the ticket link.

Please note: This is an online class. Studio Resident, Matt Reynolds will cover the basics of character cut-out puppet construction and animation. He will demonstrate how to plan, design, and produce paper puppet pieces to then build into an anatomically functional puppet. After the puppet is constructed, he will show how to use a smartphone and the Stop Motion Studio App to create a DIY downshooter to use in order to animate the newly constructed puppet. With a few demonstration frames exemplifying how best to manipulate the paper puppet for animation, he will show how to playback the captured frames and export the footage. Participants need not have any prior experience with animation in order to participate.

title: Ocean Park Book Group
description:
The Ocean Park Book Group meets the 1st Saturday of the month, and is open to all.
In The Water Dancer, the debut novel by Ta-Nehisi Coates, young Hiram Walker is born into bondage. When his mother is sold away, Hiram is robbed of all memory of her - but is gifted with a mysterious power. Years later, when Hiram almost drowns in a river, that same power saves his life. This brush with death births an urgency in Hiram and a daring scheme - to escape from the only home hes ever known. Register to attend this program by emailing karen.reitz@smgov.net.
address:
Offsite or Virtual Programs
Santa Monica, CA 90401

title: Online Hanbok 101: Jeogory (Shirt Design) with Chuck Hohng
description:
Saturday August 1 from 10am-1pm
Cost: FREE

Please note: This is an online class. Jeogory is a traditional Korean shirt which counts as innerwear for men and outwear for women. Today, younger generation Koreans wear them as a casual outerwear for both. Learn basic construction for the shirt in smaller scale; pattern will be provided. It can be used for a larger size garment by simply expanding scale-by-scale. Basic understanding for hand sewing is required. Sewing machine recommended. This is for intermediate sewers.

title: The Social Services Commission Regular Meeting
description: The mission of the Social Services Commission is to preserve and enhance the quality of life for all residents of the City of Santa Monica. Through ongoing dialogue, outreach, education and advocacy, the Social Services Commission will advise and assist the City Council and staff with needs assessment, priorities, planning, and budgetary implications for social service programs.
